inn1.comm: starts off with a tempter around the fifth-stump channel outside off, left alone
full and even wider this time, around a set of stumps outside off, Chari is happy to let it go to the wicketkeeper
takes it further outside off with the angle as the ball moves away around the crease, called a wide
fuller ball and close to off-stump, this time draws the batsman forward, and Chari presses forward and looks to take a single after dropping it into the off side but the non-striker denies the single
full ball, takes it away from the batsman and it moves away late outside off
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches off the backfoot to covers
full and a set of stumps outside off, hint of late away movement, left alone
some width on offer outside off, Chari looks to hang back in the crease and slap it away but gets beaten
offers some width outside off and Chibhabha gets off the mark straight away as he runs it down to third man
fuller length ball, 129kph and holding its line outside off, Chari shoulders arms
width on offer outside off, Chari gets a stride forward and takes a step or two towards the bowler before steering it to point. Can't beat the fielder there

length ball, holding its line in the channel outside off, Chari opens the face of his bat and steers it to third man, wide of the fielder at point this time to finally get off the mark, off his ninth ball
good length ball that is angled in towards the right-hander. Chibhabha is sure of his off-stump, though and lets it go to the wicketkeeper

beautiful line. Gets it to land on a length just outside off, tries to tempt the batsman to reach out for it but Chibhabha is equal to the task and lifts his bat as the ball goes through to the wicketkeeper

short of a length, angling in from just outside off, Chari tries to jump up and ride the bounce before slapping it through the off side but he gets cramped for room. It gets big on him as well and ends up chopping it to the ground

back of a length that is angling in to the batsman, Chari tucks it off the hips to square leg, they take a quick single and think of the second. Chari sends Chibhabha back but the throw from the fielder running in is horribly wide and the ball goes away for four overthrows
short ball outside off, Chibhabha keeps it away, albeit not comfortably, to the off side
short and wide outside off, tries to hang back and slap it away but the ball gets really big on him, there is some considerable bounce on that and he gets comprehensively beaten
short of a length, fired wide from the crease and angling, Chibhabha is sure of his off-stump and confidently lets it go to the wicketkeeper
back of a length and angling, tucked off the pads to deep backward square leg
fuller ball outside off, gets it to move slightly away but the batsman presses forward and manages to get into a comfortable position before driving through covers
short, wide, in the slot and slapped away through covers for the first boundary of the morning. Chibhabha shuffles across to protect the off sutmp and slashes it through point
back of a length, angling in, tucked to square leg
good length ball, attacking the stumps, Chair pushes it back to the bowler off the front foot
steered down to third man for a single

cleaned him up with a superb fuller, inswinging delivery.It came in at some pace and Chibhabha tries to clip it away to the leg side but gets beaten by the pace on that delivery and the ball goes from underneath to flatten off and leg stump
short and wide, tries to slap it away but it bounces a tad more than he expects. Chari also tried to hit it too hard and ends up losing shape over the attempted cut
length ball outside off, presses forward to get close to it before punching it into covers
fuller this time and around the fourth or fifth stump channel, Masakadza comes forward and eases a drive between covers and extra cover

dropped. Very tough chance, however. It was struck firmly and Rovman Powell has little time to react to it. It was short and wide and Chari slaps it hard. It's a packed off-side field, however, and he picks out cover-point where Rovman Powell gets behind it by leaning across to his right but spills it
driven down to mid-on
back of a length outside off, waits for it in the crease before steering it to gully
good length ball, fired wide of the crease and angling in, Masakadza comes forward and blocks it into the off side
short of a length and angling in, the inward angle takes it too far down the leg side, however, and Masakadza just turns around and lifts his bat
good length ball outside off, left alone

fuller and angling in outside off, thinks of driving it after planting his front foot across. But he decides againt it late and takes the bat out the line of the ball late. Could have just got the ball to his the back of the bat as he was a tad late in withdrawing his bat
length ball outside off, drops it into the off side. No run there
length ball that is angling in, tucked to midwicket and takes off for a quick single. Direct throw could have been close but the fielder fumbles
back of a length ball, Masakadza backs away and drops it with a horizontal bat in front of cover-point
full and on the stumps, clipped off the pads just to the right of mid-on
back of a length, holding its line outside off, punched off the backfoot to cover-point and the bowler has overstepped
offers up a harmless full toss wide outside off in the free hit ball. Masakadza accepts it gleefully and absolutely slams it square of the wicket. And the bowler has overstepped again
fires a full and wide delivery. The batsman can't make contact as he goes after it but it's wide of the crease, so the free hit continues. In fact, the bowler had overstepped again there

full and outside off, tries to go big over the off side but does not find the middle of the bat. Gets it off the splice and the ball goes uppishly behind square. Lands on the bounce as two fielders converge on it and they take a brace
full and holding its line outside off, punched solidly off the front foot but straight to extra cover
good length ball, stays in the crease and knocks it to extra cover
good length ball, shaping in, left alone outside off
fuller ball outside off, shuffles across to cover his stumps before pushing it into the off side
fuller ball, dabs it with soft hands towards mid-on and takes off for a quick single
full and shaping in but sprays it on the pads, clipped wide of mid-on and they get back for the second by the time the throw can be fired in
back of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot and Masakadza gets it off the inside part of the bat towards mid-on
very full ball, angling in from outside off, drilled back to the bowler
length ball outside off, backs away to make room before bringing out the cut. But he can't beat cover
short of a length outside off, opens the face of his bat to steer it to backward point
gets it to jag back in from outside off, fuller length, pushed down the pitch
good length outside off, fends it off awkwardly with a flat bat off the inside part of the bat to mid-on
short ball outside off, backs away and ducks to let it go

appeal for lbw, not given. It was fuller and angling in. Chari is caught in the crease as he tries to flick it to the leg side. Gets rapped on the pads but the angle suggests that it would have missed leg and the umpire rules it not out. Replays show that the ball took a big inside edge before hitting him on the pad
short and wide, cut to cover-point
comes forward and blocks into the off side. It's a packed field there and there is no run

good late improvisation. Shuffles across very late to cover all three stumps before lifting this fuller ball over the leg side. Heaves it over the leg side and the ball goes to the cow corner boundary
very full ball on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
short of a length outside off, punched to point
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot just to the right of the fielder at cover-point who dives but can't get his hands to it
gets a good stride forward and drives into the covers where it is packed and he can't find the gap
floats this full on middle from wide of the crease, pushed to cover
arches back and then awkwardly fends that short ball on off stump towards point
punched to wide mid-on as they scamper through for a quick single
width on offer, punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
this one's fuller and around off, Masakadza is cramped for room as he defends it back down the pitch
digs a short ball in towards middle and leg, helped to fine leg as they jog the single
fired into middle, squeezed back down the pitch
tossed up on middle, he gets forward and pats it to the off side

and there's the breakthrough immediately after the rain break. Masakadza, it seems, has fallen to a lapse in concentration. This one's fired intoo the blockhole from wide of the crease, Masakadza is late to get forward and end up yorking himself. Lack of feet movement may have contributed to his downfall too
tossed up outside off, pushed to the off side
gets forward to defend but can only manage an inside-edge onto the pad
long-hop on middle, he rocks back and pulls him all along the ground to deep midwicket
full outside off, he gets his bat down on time to keep it out
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it down to mid-on, he really had to hurry as he was pushed back into the crease while defending it
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives it to sweeper cover
full and straight on middle, almost yorker length, squeezed back down the pitch
gets back into the crease and defend, the bat face turns in his hand. He's working up some serious pace at the moment
hit high on the thigh pad as he looks to whip it away. Ervine is on the ground. He shaped to pull but the ball hurried onto him and he fell over. He seems to be fine though
stretches forward and pats the tossed up delivery back to the bowler
loopy delivery outside off, he's a long way forward as he smothers the spin
steps out to drive but is deceived in flight as Bishoo shortens his length, stabbed away off the pad
pushed through quicker on middle, punched back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, he gets outside the line of the stumps and bunts it to point
shortens his length but this one skids through on off, squeezed to the off side. Maiden over
looks to flick but is beaten by the late inward movement and bounce. Hit on the top of the thigh pad
shapes to drive, slices it down to third man instead as they jog a single
width on offer, flayed on the up to third man
floats this at length on middle stump, he leans forward and pats it back down the pitch
wonder if he's still hampered by a sore hip from the blow he took an over earlier. Falls over as he looks to whip it away, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to the leg side and they take a single
angles a length ball into the pads, worked wide of midwicket for a quick single
quicker one on off, pushed to cover
short and wide outside off, he rocks back and cuts it to point for a quick single
googly this time, he turned the bat face early to flick and gets a leading edge, fortunately it rolls to the bowler
full-blooded sweep this time in front of square towards the boundary rider
lucky to get away with that gift of a delivery. Drags it short and wide outside off, slapped off the backfoot to deep point
full on the pad, worked to midwicket
some bounce for him from length on off, hit on the thigh pad as he looks to work it with the spin towards midwicket
this one skids back in with the arm to cramp him for room, pushed to midwicket. There was a brief misfield, but not enough to steal a single
flicked with the spin to Bishoo at deep midwicket
short but this was coming back in with the arm from around the stumps, chopped to point
uppish but just short of the bowler. Deceived in flight as he looked to work it to the on side
rocks back to cut but the ball kicks off from the rough just outside off and bounces as keeper collects it almost near his face. That surprised the batsman!

completely done in by the skidder. Chari's eyes lit up as he saw that short and rocked back to pull, but got himself into a right royal mess in his quest to heave it from outside off. Didn't have much room and by the time he swung through, the ball had already crashed into the stumps.
this one drifts away, he gets a thick inside edge on the pad as he defends
cuts, there's a misfield at point but there's confusion, they finally decide to take the single
stretches forward and works it wide of the bowler, towards long-on
this is a flipper that skids on, he shapes back to cut but didn't have the room, somehow gets bat on it as point stops that
pushed through quicker on off, not much turn this time, bunted back down the pitch
tossed up on middle from around the stumps, he gets forward and blocks
hint of turn away, he plays a delicate late dab to short third man where there's a misfield. What should have been one is now two. Poor from West Indies

the ball drifted back in and spun away from the rough on middle, Ervine played down the wrong line as he looked to work it across the line. He's hit on the back leg too, which means the ball didn't have much distance to travel. The only thing that could have saved him was bat, and in this case there was none. So, Zimbabwe's decision to take a review hasn't worked this time. They're in deep strife now.
drift and turn from off stump again, pushed to the off side

mayhem! West Indies are all over this. Williams has to go and he'll curse himself for jabbing forward without any conviction. This ball was a touch fuller on off, but it kicked off from a patch around off stump. The hard jab found the edge and Shai Hope, who rode the bounce, made a potentially difficult catch look easy. Zimbabwe in a mess
shapes to pull but the ball stopped on him and spun past leg stump by a whisker even as he was through with the pull. Lucky break. What was PJ Moor thinking!
drawn forward by the flight around off, pushed to the off side
squared up as the ball takes the edge and rolls to short third man
width on offer, crashed off the backfoot but straight to point
pushed with the spin to cover point. Once again there's flight and dip for Bishoo
was there bat? Reaction of West Indies' players suggests so. This spun away from the rough to take the outside edge and fly to the left of the slip fielder. Very, very close.
fired in full on off, he gets half-forward and dabs it back down the pitch
lopped up outside off, Raza comes forward loooking to defend but the ball hits the pad and goes to the wicketkeeper. Impact outside off
sharp turn from a length, defended back to the bowler
short of a length and spinning in sharply, tucked with the turn to deep square leg
backs away to this fuller length ball which spins back in sharply and fends it off to the off side
too full from Nurse which does not allow the ball to turn as much. Moor gets right on top of that and slogs it over deep midwicket for a clean six

a near run out. short of a length, does not spin away as much and keeps low but he slas it away to sweeper cover where there is a misfield. They try to steal a second but Raza is sent back after coming half way down. The throw is very poor and very wide of the stumps which allows him to put in a dive and make it back. Run out the last thing Zimbabwe need here
knocks it to sweeper cover
flatter on the stumps, comes forward and defends
tossed up on the stumps, comes forward and defends
fuller ball, eased down to long-on
sliding down the leg side with the arm, Moor tries to tuck and misses, called a wide
what a shot! It was full and right in the slot outside off. Moor picks it up early and has enough room, absolutely flays through long-off and the ball goes on the bounce over the boundary
turns and bounces sharply, tries to tuck it but can't make contact and the ball goes off the thigh to fine leg
defended back to the bowler

is that a bat-pad? Raza came forward to defend this length ball but the ball spins in and hits him on the apd before lobbing behind square on the elg side. The wicketkeeper runs across and fields it but there was no inside edge
knocks it back to the bowler
tucked behind square to the leg side
flighted outside off, driven to sweeper cover
punched off the backfoot to sweeper cover
blocked into the off side
flatter on middle stumps, tucked to midwicket
very full outside off, drilled to mid-on
comes forward to defend but does not account for the turn and the ball spins past the outside edge and narrowly misses the stumps
short and wide, backs away to cut but the ball spins in sharply and he gets cramped for room, fielded at cover
backs away to this shorter ball ans cuts to sweeper cover
comes forward to this fuller ball and blocks into the off side
stays back and opens the face of his bat to steer it to square third man

bowled him. Backs away to cut through the off side but that is always going to be a difficult shot to play when there is so much turn, especially against the turn. Moor backed across a long way and exposed all his stumps. The ball spins very sharply and he gets cramped for room, can't make any contact and the ball crasehs into the stumps. Poor shot selection
fuller and attacking the stumps, defended towards mid-on
short and wide outside off, slashes at it and gets it through point
tossed up on the stumps, defended off the front foot to the bowler
length ball, does not spin away as much, punched off the backfoot down to long-on
fuller and on the stumps, presses forward and pushes it back to the bowler
fuller and slightly wide outside off, comes forward and pushes it into the gap between cover and point

another terrible shot. It was short and quick from Bishoo. Cremer goes for a pull shot but this one, unlike many others before, does not turn as much and Cremer has no room to play the pull shot. Gets an inside edge on to the stumps for his troubles
pitched up outside off, comes forward and drives it wide of mid-off
bowls it full and on the stumps, pushed into the off side
not much turn this time and Tiripano comes forward to this fuller ball and defends into the off side
tucks this length ball off the pads square leg
gets it to turn in sharply from the good length region, tucked with the spin to deep square leg
short ball, spinning back in, this time it gets up to a comfortable height for the batsman and Tiripano pulls to deep midwicket
bowls it full outside off, Tiripano comes forward and pushes it towards point
fuller and outside off, meets the pitch of the ball before easing it down to long-off
nudges it with the turn to the leg side. The wicketkeeper fields it and there is no run there
gets down to sweep and the ball turns enough for his liking as Raza works it to deep backward square leg
wild swing to this fuller ball outside off that goes through straight to the keeper and Raza, looking to go square of the wicket can't make contatc
driven to sweeper cover
pitched up on the stumps, blocked down the pitch to the right of the bowler
floated up outside off, Raza pushes it into the covers
short of a length and spinning in on middle and leg, punched off the backfoor back to the bowler
comes forward to drive this fuller ball and gets it off the inside edge as he drags it to square leg
tucked to square leg and they take the single by the time the fielder in the deep can run in and field it
eased down to long-on
comes forward and defends to point
hangs back to this length ball that keeps a tad low, works it to extra cover

comes forward to defend and gets a mild outside edge. Didn't push hard at it so it does not carry to the diving first slip fielder and the ball escapes past him to third man. It is pulled back before the boundary but they have enough time to mcome back for the third
driven to sweeper cover
waits to assess the turn on this wider ball before knocking it carefully twards covers
drilled back to the bowler who dives to stop it
fired into middle from wide of the crease, punched past cover
slow turn in, Tiripano looks to steer it past short third man but chops it to slip
skids back in to take an inside edge. Would have been very close had he missed
hit on the pad as he gets back to defend, but struck outside off
stabs forward and is hit on the pad but outside the line of the stumps
top work at mid-on to ensure a sliding stop but the throw at the keeper's end is wide and they scamper an overthrow. So the good work is undone
gets on top of the bounce and bunts it down to gully
floats this full outside off, angled wide of point for an easy isngle
gets outside the line of the stumps and plays a short-arm jab to deep square leg
length ball on off stump from wide of the crease, defended with hard hands
hits the deck hard, Tiripano looks to give him the charge to flay that one over the off side but is cramped for room and defends
can't take toll of that short ball. Mistimes a cut to cover
gets to the pitch of the ball and smothers the spin
steps out, gets to the pitch, negates the spin and crashes that past mid-off. Excellent timing, even better placement. Welcome boundary
defends a full delivery from the crease towards midwicket. Would have been very close had he missed it
punched to wide mid-on. Once again not much turn, this one skid on
spins back in to take the inside edge as he tries to play into the cover region
the skidder outside off keeps a touch low to roll off the toe end of the bat towards point
cramped for room as the length ball keeps coming back in with the angle to roll off the thick outside edge to the off side
full and close to the stumps this time, defended solidly to cover
pulled and executed very well. But this slow outfield because of the rain means the ball pulls up. Evin Lewis does well to pull it back in too.
into the gap behind point, down to third man. Got on top of the bounce to punch that
chopped to point. Didn't get the width he was looking for
slips this into blockhole, squeezed into the gap between cover and point
there's sharp turn back in, he prods forward to defend and is hit high on the pad
stretches forward and accounts for sharp turn before deadbatting that
hint of width outside off, steered wide of point as they amble a single
gets the execution of the reverse sweep wrong, this is played towards cover, when he was actually looking to ease it past short third man
fired into middle from wide of the crease, he's solidly behind the line of the ball as he defends
tosses it up nicely in anticipation of the batman looking to clear the infield, but he's happy to block
starts off with a length ball outside off, left alone
firm push off the front foot to mid-off as they scamper a single

cleverly done. Tiripano is showing why he's an improved batsman and has the capability of batting a lot higher than he does. This one is dug in short, he stays inside the crease, arches back and ramps it over the keeper's head. Superb touch
the ball veers back in to take a thick inside edge on a forward defense
back of length delivery on off, he get back and across, and blocks
thumped but straight to point. It was short and there was room for him to hit it wherever he pleased
short of length delivery outside off, punched to deep point
floats it full on middle and leg, Tiripano gets a thick inside edge that rolls towards midwicket
slower and fuller outside off, driven firmly to mid-off as they scamper a single
bangs a short ball in from wide of the crease but this way way over Raza's head. Rightly called wide
awkward bounce but he does well to get onto his toes and fend it to the off side for a quick single

just when you praise him, he plays a poor shot to undo all the good work. This was an excellent bouncer on middle, Tiripano shaped to pull but is beaten for pace and could only manage a top edge that was gleefully accepted by wicketkeeper Shai Hope.
a yorker-length delivery once again, this one from wide of the crease. Jammed towards midwicket
pushes outside the line and gets a thick inside edge down to fine leg. Off the mark
turned towards short midwicket, he wanted the run but Chisoro wasn't ready
too full, steered into the gap between cover and point. The boundary rider does the mopping up
nearly through his defence. This one nipped back in from around the stumps. Kept low and nearly shaved past the off stump as Chisoro was completely beaten
drawn forward but gets a thick edge as he pushes hard at the delivery, third man had no chance. Welcome boundary
hops back and helps the short ball down to fine leg
angles this one down leg, all Chisoro needed to do was get some bat on it and he's just done that. Neatly tickled into the fine leg boundary
bunts a length ball to midwicket and scampers through for a quick single. There was a direct hit at the bowler's end but Chisoro used his reach to good effect
fired in full on middle and leg from wide of the crease, worked to deep square leg
excellent bouncer on middle from around the stumps, Chisoro is caught on the hop as that hits his bat handle
this time he stays inside the crease and helps the short ball down to fine leg
gets the direction wrong. Length ball sliding into leg stump and past his pads
tucks the incoming length delivery off his hip to fine leg
gets this one to tail back into middle, he pushes outside the line and gets an inside edge that rolls to midwicket
full and coming back into middle and leg, driven down to long on as they amble the single
solidly behind the line of that length ball as he defends
mistimes a drive but gets enough bat on it nonetheless, long-on comes in quickly to stop that
width and he's drilled that straight to deep cover. A meter on either side and it was four
that's a no-ball. It's a beamer just around off, Raza jumps up before managing to slash at it and work it to square third man
short ball that pitches on leg, swivels around and pulls it to fine leg
full ball, Raza pushes it down the ground. Raza calls for the second but Chisoro does not respond favourably, he just jogged the single through. Could have pushed the fielder there
looks to tuck to the leg side but gets it off the pad
full ball outside off, comes forward and defends with bat close to pad
good length, fired from wide of the crease and angling in, Raza drops it in front of covers and takes off for a quick single

full ball on the stumps, Chisoro stays in the crease and gently dabs it just wide of mid-on. They don't take the single and Raza will take first strike in the next over. Chisoro seems to be struggling here. Raza is pushing him hard for the extra runs and he is panting
on the blockhole on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for a single
full on the fifth-stump channel, blocks it quietly back to the bowler
short ball, swivels around with the pull and pats it to deep backward square leg
length ball, jags back in from outside off, Raza drops it in front of point and calls for a quick single, Chisoro is able to complete it
low full toss on, angling in around off, Chisoro dabs it in front of mid-on and takes on the fielder there for a quick single. Fumble allows them to easily complete it

length ball, tucked to midwicket for another very sharp single. Midwicket slightly fumbles and they think of the second just for a moment but the ball does not get away too much from the fielder and they decide against it
short of a length, angling in from outside off, jumps back up and defends back towards the bowler

yorker outside off, Raza drills it down towards long-off and calls for two immediately, but again, does not get a good response from Chisoro who does not seem to be interested in the single. Not sure if there was a second run on that occasion, though
tucked to square leg
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to deep backward square leg
good length on the fifth-stump channel, punched off the backfoot to mid-off
ends the over with a fuller ball that is driven to mid-off

back of a length ball, tucked off the pads, actually, he misses it and gets it off the pad towards fine leg before the wicketkeeper runs across to cut it off. The crowd cheers initially thinking that's his fifty, but he was to wait longer
runs it down to third man

full and on the pads, dabs it with soft hands to the vacant mid-on region and they easily take the single by the time the fielder in the deep can run in and field it. And now, it'll be his fifty. Does a fist pump as he acknowledges the applause from the dressing room
short ball, swivels around with the pull but bottom-edges it
short ball again, this time he gets the pull shot bang off the middle. But there is a man at deep square leg, so it will only be a single

full toss on the stumps, turns it away between long-on and deep midwicket and calls for the single. This time, Chisoro responds. Long-on runs across and fires a throw at the non-striker's end where Holder gathers it cleanly and dislodges the bails. They go upstairs to check for the run out, but he has comfortably made it home
sprays it down the leg side, Chisoro tries to glance but makes no contact
fuller ball outside off, drilled wide of long-off who darts across but fails to collect the ball cleanly allowing the extra run
short ball, pulled to deep square leg
full and on the stumps, drilled down to long-on
fuller ball, angling in, clipped off the toes between midwicket and long-on, long-on runs across and cuts it off
slower full ball outside off, absolutely no pace on it, so he can only drill it down to long-off
very full and pushed a long way across the left-hander. Chisoro tries to reach out for it and despite stretching a long way across, can't make contact
tries to go over the off side but does not get it off the middle of the bat and skews it slightly off the splice. But the ball clears the in-field before it is fielded at sweeper cover
full and pushed across outside off, gets a good stride across and leans into a drive to sweeper cover
short ball outside off, Raza sways out of the line and lets it go
fuller ball outside off, calls early for two after clipping it wide of long-on but Chisoro is happy to settle for a single
on the pads, Chisoro picks it up from them and works it to short fine leg

short ball, gets up to ride the bounce and pulls it to deep midwicket. There is a direct hit at the non-striker's end and they go upstairs to see if Chisoro has made it back. He's comfortably in. In fact, it's one short as the batsman has not crossed the crease before taking off for the second
fuller ball on the fifth-stump line, Chisoro eases it down to long-off on the front foot
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to deep midwicket and calls for two. They make it comfortably
length ball, angling in, tries to tuck to the on side, but gets it off the pads towards square leg
attacks the stumps and pitches it up on the stumps, clipped away to deep midwicket

fires it wide outside off, Raza tries to slap it with a horizontal bat but it was too full for that shot and the ball does not get up as much. It was also the legcutter which Raza didn't pick and he gets beaten
knocks it down to long-on
full and in the slot outside off, there was some width on offer and Raza makes some more room by clearing his front leg and whipping it powerfully through covers

fires it full and outside off, takes the pace off and Raza attempts to heave it over long-off. Carlos Brathwaite is slightly wide and over-runs as he tries to get around it allowing the batsman to take the second
full toss outside off, it was the slower ball again, whipped down the ground just wide of long-off and they again take on the fielder and comfortably get back for the second
full and outside off, drills it off the front foot straight to sweeper cover, so it will just be one this time

slightly short of a length outside off and it was right in the slot for Chisoro who pulls it powerfully as the ball sails clean over the deep square leg fence. And that brings up the 200 for Zimbabwe. Last fifty coming off 47 balls

compensates well with a wide yorker outside off, Chisoro tries to jam his bat down and squeeze it out towards third man. There is a slight noise as the ball goes to the wicketkeeper. Holder asks for a review as the keeper appeals straightaway and they are checking for a caught behind. Doesn't seem like there was any contact between bat and ball. After a few replays, it is ruled not out
good bowling. Raza was backing away to give himself room but brathwaite pitches it right up and bowls a yorker that is squeezed out to point

slower short ball, there is not much pace on it at all and Chisoro has all the time to pick that up and get in position. It sits up and there is no pace so Chisoro can get on top of it and he pulls it over deep square leg
drilled powerfully to long-off
full and wide outside off, heaves it over the off side in-field and the ball goes through the deep extra cover fence. No fielder in the deep there
tries to get inside the of the ball and scoop it over fine leg. But it was a length ball and it bounces more than he would have liked and he ends up making no contact
goes for a slog but does not find the middle of the bat. The ball goes towards deep midwicket where it is fielded

inn2.comm: pitched up on off, drilled straight to mid-off
flighted on off stump, not much turn, firm push off the frontfoot to mid-off again
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it with the angle to deep midwicket
chips the simplest of return catches. This one didn't turn, Charles made the mistake of closing the bat face early and ended up getting a leading edge back to the bowler.
gets to the pitch of the ball and drives to cover
loopy delivery on off stump, driven to mid-off where Chibhabha misfields to concede a single. Poor effort.
worked with the spin to midwicket as they jog the single
short, wide and he's slapped that between cover and mid-off. Too easy, was sitting up nicely for him to give it a good thwack
errs in length and this time he's thumped it between cover and point. Waited, waited and then cracked it away into the gap there. Top shot
slow turn from outside off, held his length back a wee bit this time, left alone
short but spinning away again from outside off, left alone
slider into middle from around the stumps, punched to cover
too full on middle from around the stumps, he gets forward and defends
lunges a long way forward and deadbats that in-drifter
short outside off, cut away but straight to cover point
gets this to drift into the pads, worked wide of midwicket

this one breaks back in sharply from outside off, Lewis plays all around the delivery. Would have been better off playing with a straight bat. He's hit high on the pad but he was deep inside the crease, which means the ball didn't have to travel a long way. The leg stump was visible too at the point of impact. Third umpire had a long and hard look at it before adjudging Lewis out. From the replays it was clear that there was no inside edge. West Indies in some trouble here, and it's spin that's doing the trick.
gets behind the line of that quicker delivery on middle and dabs to the off side. Eventful over
tossed up outside off, pushed back to the bowler
quicker delivery on middle, he gets half-forward and blocks
can't take toll of that short delivery. There was width too and he picked out point
this one spins back into middle and leg, he gets across and bunts it to the leg side
gets across the line of the stumps and blocks
slow turn back into middle, punched back to the bowler.
how did he not get an edge, I don't know. Tossed up outside off, the batsman is sucked into the drive but didn't get to the pitch of it. Beaten
drifts into middle and leg, played to short midwicket
stretches forward and keeps out that full delivery on middle
beaten by square turn. This was bowled quicker and just at length. Deviated a long way to miss the outside edge. Grip, turn and bounce
gets a half-stride in to ease that with the spin to cover
this one stops on him as he goes back deep into the crease to defend, takes the bottom hand off the grip while defending that.
tossed up on middle, he gets forward and pats it back down the pitch
touch short on middle and leg, keeps low as well, worked wide of midwicket
edged, but just short of slip. This was beautifully bowled. Batsman pushes at it with hard hands, deceived in flight and was lucky to survive
drifts back in to beat the inside edge and hit the thigh pad
gets back and across to punch it wide of midwicket
gets outside the line of the stumps and turns it with the angle to short midwicket
gets his bat well in front of the pad to defend that tossed up delivery
should have done better. Poor at point. Hit hard, but the fielder dived over the ball. Easy runs, that should relieve some pressure on West Indies
full on the pads, worked with the angle towards the vacant midwicket region
slapped off the back foot to the cover boundary. Too short, he rocked back, picked the length early and put that away without much fuss
another short delivery, this time he hits it to the left of cover. Poor delivery. Trying to do too much, perhaps?
fired into middle and leg, turned to the leg side for a quick single
driven with spin past the diving cover fielder, who half-stopped it
smeared that to cover, good stop there by Ervine
drifting into the pads, looks to tickle it fine but gets some pad, rolls to short fine leg
squared up by sharp turn, took ages to get to him though, played back down the pitch in the end
drawn forward by the flight, gets to the pitch of it and eases it past the bowler
driven with the spin to long-off
drifts into middle and spins away, he stays inside the crease and punches it to deep cover
not much turn this time, he stretches forward and blocks
slow turn from middle, eased with the spin to long-off as they jog the single
this one comes back in to cramp him for room, bunted to the off side
width and he's crashed that past the infield to wide long-off
gets the bat well in front of the pad and blocks that flighted delivery
tossed up on middle and leg, he stretches forward and defends

attempt a loose drive and is pouched in the slips. The ball flew, but Masakadza moved quickly to his right to take a low catch. There was a hint of spin but Hope was nowhere near the pitch of the ball as he looked to crash that into the cover region.
there's a leg slip and he's mindful of that as he stays inside the crease and negotiates that late
worked with the spin to short midwicket
gets well forward and turns it to midwicket
this one's fired across the batsman at length, bunted back down the pitch
spin straight away for Cremer, Brathwaite manages to keep it out to the off side
short ball, Brathwaite gets in position early and pulls powerfully to deep midwicket
comes forward to defend and gets it off the inside part of the bat to midwicket
fuller ball on middle and off, clips it with the turn past midwicket. The bowler was momentarily excited but it was well wide of the fielder at mid-on
defended off the front foot down the pitch
fuller ball, angling in, pushed into the off side
pushed across to the left-hander from around the wicket, blocked
flat and short of a length, tucked off the pads to deep square leg
sliding in with the arm on leg stump, clipped away to the leg side
pitched up on the pads, defended down the pitch back to the bowler
tucked off the pads and picks the gap between midwicket and square leg
fired wide outside off, not much turn back in, left alone
full toss on the stumps, driven to long-off

chance, put down. Tucked fine off the pads. It was full and spinning in, Carter tucks it fine past the diving leg slip fielder, who leaps to his left but the ball gets past him. The ball is nearly chased down by the fielder at short fine leg. He gets down but does not get his hands to the ball as tries to pull it back and falls over past the ropes
gets through everything. It was fuller and Carter swooped down to sweep but misses and the wicketkeeper misses the ball as well as it keeps low
length ball, spinning in, pushed through quicker, tucked to deep midwicket
pitching on a length around off and spinning away, left alone
comes forward and pushes this fuller ball to point
gets down to sweep this fuller ball but it is fired down the leg side and he can't make contact
full and on the stumps, blocked off the front foot
fuller outside off, leans forward into the drive to covers
shuffles across and punches off the backfoot into the covers region
good length, attacking the stumps, defended off the front foot into the off side
fired flat and full on the pads, swept to deep backward square leg
good length, spinning in from outside off, blocked from the crease down the pitch
fuller ball, presses forward and drives into the covers region
spinning back in sharply from the good length region, tucked with the turn to fine leg
fuller ball, spins away sharply after landing around off. Brathwaite leaves it as he trusts the turn on that one and is sure of his off-stump
low full toss on the stumps, whipped through midwicket, the fielder in the deep makes a diving save
fuller and on leg stump, defended off the front foot to covers
comes forward and eases into a push which is fielded at cover
fired full and on the stumps from around the wicket, defended off the front foot towards the bowler
very full this time, drilled hard back to the bowler
pushed across on the leg stump channel, clipped away to mid-on
fuller and outside off, Carter presses forward and nudges it down to long-on
full toss, whipped away to mid-on where a diving stop is made
eased down to long-on
fuller ball outside off, driven past the diving extra cover fielder, the ball is fielded by long-off who runs across to cut it off
swept to deep square leg
clipped off the toes to midwicket
gives it a lot of air and almost hits the blockhole outside off, Carter presents a straight bat and knocks it down the ground
tucked uppishly off the pads to deep backward square leg
full just outside off, presses forward and pushes it to covers
pushed through quicker on a length, defended off the backfoot to the bowler
overpitched outside off, it's a half-volley and right in the slot. Carter opens up his arms and crunches a drive through extra cover. Hit very hard
comes forward to defend and gets it off the inside part of the bat towards square leg before the wicketkeeper rruns across and fields it

direct hit from Craig Ervine at the striker's end and this may be gone. Zimbabwe are confident and are celebrating. Ooh, Brathwaite's not even close. He's a long way out. It was full and outside off. Carter leans across and pushes it into covers before calling for a quick single. Brathwaite responds and a moment's hesitation costs him
short of a length outside off, punched off the backfoot to short midwicket
defended down the pitch to the right of the bowler
pushed through fuller outside off, Carter gets forward and pushes it into covers
short ball, swivels around with the pull and whacks it to deep square leg. Rolls his wrists over it to keep it down
googly that is pushed across outside off, Carter sticks his bat out to defend as he plays for the turn but the ball shoots past the outside edge
pushed down to long-off
fuller ball outside off, driven to long-off
full ball, drilled down the ground and Cremer sticks his foot out but can't stop it. Mid-off and mid-on converge on it and a throw is fired at the keeper's end but they make it comfortably
full and angling in on the stumps, driven straight down the ground. Carter gets right to the pitch of it and beats the fielder at mid-on who flings himself to his right
full and attacking the stumps from around the wicket, fires it on the middle stump channel, eased down to long-off
punched off the backfoot to the left of the bowler who gathers it on his follow-through
pushes it wide of off stump and it's left alone
fuller ball on the stumps, eased down to long-on
full and on the stumps, driven to long-off
tossed up and angled down leg, swept hard to fine leg
stops on him a touch as he's already on the backfoot, pushed to cover
firm drive but straight to the cover fielder again
eased with the spin to wide long-off as they jog the single
rocks back and pulls the short ball towards deep midwicket
defends that indrifter towards middle and leg
close, close, close. Powell sets off for a non-existent single. Had the throw from point hit the bowler's end, he was a dead duck
beaten by a classic delivery that nips away off the seam. Shaped to drive, only to see the ball shave past the outside edge
driven past the bowler to mid-off, a misfield gives them a single
this one nips back in to cut him into halves. He poked outside the line to miss it completely. Top stuff this from Mpofu
goes for a lofted drive, gets a thick inside edge that rolls into the gap at deep midwicket
this one tails back in from length outside off, defended with a straight bat
spins back in to take the inside edge and PJ Moor has made a mess of a straightforward chance.  How costly will that be?
worked with the spin past square leg
slow turn from middle, eased wide of point as they scamper the single
fetches the sweep from outside off towards deep square leg

this is a big moment in this match. An opportunity was missed earlier in the over, but there's relief and a wicket in the form of Powell, who has just committed hara-kiri. Looks to loft that over long-off but didn't get underneath the flight, which the ball lobbed high off a thick outside edge, and the fielder in the deep settled underneath it to complete a low catch. Zimbabwe are alive and kicking. Big, big moment in the game.
gets across the stumps and works it with the spin to short midwicket
prods forward and gets a thick outside edge that runs past slip and into the third man boundary. Did well to take the bottom hand off the grip to ensure it didn't carry. Superb bowling nonetheless
draws him into a push, but the ball nips ever-so-slightly from the length area outside off to beat the outside edge
plants forward and bunts that delivery to cover
forced off the frontfoot to cover. Once again there was width but a hint of away-movement
crunching cover drive that splits cover and point. Sweet timing, outstanding placement. Didn't get to the pitch but looked very comfortable playing it on the up. Welcome runs

pulled imperiously into the deep square leg boundary. He had to fetch it from outside off, but he swivelled superbly and picked the bones out of that one. Not much you can do bowling there at 120 clicks
lunges forward and smothers the spin
gets a thick outside edge that rolls past short third man, they scamper a run
squared up by slow turn, but he can adjust late and defend
flighted outside off, he opens the bat face slightly to drive that to the left of sweeper cover
eased with the spin to Raza at cover
fired into middle from around the stumps, driven firmly but Raza throws himself to his right to pull off a one-handed stop
nips away from the length are on middle, he plays it back down the ground with a straight bat
flicked uppishly but into the gap at midwicket, excellent work by Raza, who run all the way around the ropes from deep square to cut that off through a slide
helped down to fine leg. Too short and down leg. Shouts of 'Oh, no!' from Mpofu the moment he delivered that
crunched down the ground, but straight to mid-off
slower delivery on middle and leg that beats the inside edge and hits him on the thigh pad
didn't get to the pitch of the ball but went through with the stroke and lofted it cleanly down the ground. Hit that straight as a dye. Made room, freed his arms and hammered it away. What punch!
short outside off, he makes some room and cuts it to deep point
firm push but well stopped by the bowler moving to his left
driven but straight to cover.
clears his front leg and eases it with the spin to deep cover
rocks back and punches it into the gap at cover, the man in the deep was caught napping. Williams is very angry that they conceded two when it should have just been one. Chisoro the culprit
whipped off his hip to deep square leg
shapes for a cut but went through too early. The ball skid on to beat the edge
tossed up on middle and leg, punched wide of the bowler to long-on
uppish but just past the bowler, towards long-on. This one gripped on the surface as Holder went for a hard push
